channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison aims for full reopening of Australian economy by July, global COVID-19 cases surpass 3.9 million as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The NRL is likely to favour smaller Sydney stadiums, due to be the subject of biosecurity checks this week.
item.title: Bankwest, Leichhardt Oval firm as likely hosts of Sydney NRL games

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: A Melbourne primary school principal says no plans have been developed to ensure safety when schools return, with an announcement on a return date expected imminently.
item.title: Veteran principal worried about return to school

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Concerns the coronavirus will get into Victoria's prisons or cause mammoth delays to cases have led to an increase in bail applications.
item.title: Coronavirus prompts surge in number of people seeking bail

item.description: The event is one of the first concerts to be live streamed from the venue.
item.title: Emma Pask performs live at the Sydney Opera House

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: YouTube is full of fast-moving, animated educational videos that aim to entertain as much as teach but two Queensland lecturers have shot to international acclaim with a more traditional, whiteboard-based approach.
item.title: Griffith Uni YouTube stars making educational videos with a difference

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: "I think that term loony was not an appropriate one and I've conveyed that appropriately."
item.title: Michael O'Brien cautions Tim Smith against 'loony' Premier comment

item.description: More than one hundred people turned out to protest against a range of issues including coronavirus restrictions, vaccinations and 5G.
item.title: Ten people arrested as anti-lockdown protesters clash with police

item.description: Bob Dylan, Mick Jagger and Ringo Starr are among the music legends who have paid tribute to Little Richard, widely regarded as a foundational figure in rock-and-roll.
item.title: Little Richard, flamboyant spirit of early rock-and-roll, dies at 87

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Australian Diamonds vice-captain Liz Watson is encouraging athletes to prioritise their mental health during sport shutdowns, as the risk of eating disorders and poor body image become more prevalent in professional sportspeople.
item.title: Mental health warning for elite athletes struggling through pandemic

item.description: Justin Gaethje earned the right to fight titleholder Khabib Nurmagomedov, who was grounded by travel restrictions as the MMA juggernaut
item.title: Blood, sweat, no cheers: Gaethje upsets Ferguson in fan-free UFC return

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Protesters have rallied against lockdown measures, despite warnings from police earlier this week to stay at home.Â
item.title: Ten arrested, police officer injured in anti-lockdown protest

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Racing NSW chief is hopeful big spring stakes will not take a hit from coronavirus crisis as he looks to return of normal prizemoney levels.
item.title: V'landys confident 2020 Everest will remain a $15 million peak

item.dc:creator: Taylor Denny
item.description: Firefighter Amanda Andrews helped fight bushfires over the summer, one week before Mother's Day she helped deliver a baby.
item.title: Firefighter delivers baby on the side of the road

item.description: Public transport capacity is likely to drop by 90 per cent under social distancing requirements, the Transport Minister said.
item.title: Brits pushed to cycle or walk amid public transport restrictions

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Gladys Berejiklian said the small number of daily new coronavirus cases in recent weeks and the high levels of testing had given her confidence to relax restrictions.
item.title: 'Keep our vigilance': NSW Premier defends restrictions being eased from Friday

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: Western Australiaâs leading medical association is again calling on the state to remove restrictions limiting doctorsâ abilities to test patients for COVID-19.
item.title: WA doctors call for more community spread testing as COVID-19 restrictions lift

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Getting funding has always been tough for female entrepreneurs and it appears the coronavirus pandemic is making it even more difficult.Â
item.title: Coronavirus increases funding challenges for female entrepreneurs

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Eddy Issa, 32, died late in April. His family say that they have endured numerous added traumas as a result of coronavirus precautions without complaint, but they are now seeking compassion.
item.title: Grieving family begs Victorian Premier to ease visiting restrictions

item.description: Seventy-five years after the end of World War II in Europe, Holocaust survivor Sarah Saaroni's memories of her heart-wrenching journey from Nazi tyranny to a new life in suburban Melbourne remain crystal clear.
item.title: 'I said to the Gestapo man, I am Jewish and you can shoot me'

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 8, 2020

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Should ARLC chairman Peter V'landys secure a record TV deal and get the competition restarted on May 28, he may well follow through on his intention to walk away from the game.
item.title: No worlds left to conquer? Why PVL could soon be lost to league

item.description: A look at the follies, foibles and joys of the human race through the eyes of cartoonist Michael Leunig. Buy prints from Michael Leunig at https://www.thestore.com.au/category/artists/michael-leunig. Join us on Facebook at the Michael Leunig Appreciation Page.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Michael Leunig

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 9, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 10, 2020

item.description: Port Adelaide assistant coach Jarrad Schofield has backed calls for local derbies to kick-start the AFL season when it resumes.
item.title: Schofield weighs in on AFL derby restart theory

item.description: It's another stark reminder that not even one of the nation's most secure buildings is immune from the virus.
item.title: Anthony Fauci, two other White House virus staff in quarantine

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Australia's souring relations with China have taken a turn for the worse as the nation's barley exporters face tariff threat.
item.title: China relations sour over tariff threat to Australian barley

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: Australian jazz singer Emma Pask was chosen to launch the Sydney Opera House's first performance live streamed from the Joan Sutherland Theatre.
item.title: The seats were empty but the band played on to thousands at home

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Two cases from last week have come back as false positives, Health Minister Steven Miles says, leaving the state's tally at 1045.
item.title: 'We still need to be vigilant': Qld records two new coronavirus cases

item.description: Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton admits the confusion of whether the Australian Grand Prix should have gone ahead was a huge "shock to the system".
item.title: Hamilton: Australian Grand Prix cancellation was 'very surreal'

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Australians are far more supportive of coronavirus lockdown measures and likely to trust health experts.
item.title: Australians less ideological about COVID lockdown than Americans

item.dc:creator: Lia Timson
item.description: The budget has not yet been approved, exceeding the 60-day limit prescribed by the constitution, the group of MPs argues. In their petition, they say such failure should have triggered dissolution of Parliament.
item.title: East Timor MPs in revolt as government stuck in limbo

item.description: Track improving to Soft 5 on the North West Slopes for this seven-race meeting.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Quirindi on Monday

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: A staff member at a regional Victorian hospital has tested positive to coronavirus as the state records another 10 positive cases, bringing the total to 1487.
item.title: Regional hospital staffer tests positive as anti-lockdown protesters arrested

item.description: The spotlight this week will predominantly be on the retail sector, following strong gains last week after the announcement of a staged easing of coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: Flat share market expected at open

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: Following Friday's release of a national framework, the Premier and Health Minister Roger Cook addressed media on Sunday to explain how this would look in WA.
item.title: WA's social, dining, regional travel restrictions loosen from May 18

item.dc:creator: Wayne Carey
item.description: Presented with an out-of-the-blue chance to meet his hero, Wayne Carey chose a quiet night in. Here's why the North Melbourne champion made the call he will always regret.
item.title: 'I said no': Why Wayne Carey turned down a meeting with Muhammad Ali

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Jackie Trad has resigned her ministerial responsibilities in the wake of a CCC investigation.
item.title: Deputy premier Jackie Trad resigns from cabinet

item.description: My children thrive learning offline. The online expectations for young children do not work in our home environment.
item.title: Why we've decided to learn offline

item.description: Russell Crowe said of the director of The Crossing (1990): "There is still a resonance daily in my life from the things he taught me."
item.title: George Ogilvie: 'A practitioner in nearly every branch of the theatre'

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Councils say they have not seen a cent of the NSW government's promised $82 million childcare funding a month after the rescue package was announced.
item.title: Desperate councils cry out for promised childcare funding

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.description: Tour great Peter Senior believes securing European co-sanctioned events in Australia early next year as part of a newly-revamped Australasian PGA schedule is the sport's best chance of rekindling its golden years.
item.title: Senior sees 'opportunity' in revised golf schedule

item.description: The Melbourne Digital Concert Hall hosted a week-long classical music festival featuring some of the city's best performers.
item.title: Orchestras' stars shone in a memorable week of music online

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: Julian Curwin's exquisitely crafted batch of new compositions suits the mood of the times.
item.title: Miniaturised music fitting for a shrunken world

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Brisbane City Council data shows just how quickly people switched from buses and ferries to bikes and walkways during the pandemic.
item.title: How Brisbanites swapped buses for bikes

item.description: The Sussexes, who have been living in LA with one-year-old Archie since leaving Canada shortly before borders closed due to the coronavirus lockdown.
item.title: Harry and Meghan move into $28m Beverly Hills home owned by friend of Oprah Winfrey

item.description: Germany's plans to restart competition on May 16 suffered an early setback after the entire team of second tier Dynamo Dresden were placed in a two-week quarantine following two positive coronavirus tests.
item.title: Bundesliga suffers blow after coronavirus test positives
